title: Saffron Milk During Pregnancy: Benefits, Safety, and Best Practices
description: Every culture has its time-honored remedies for nurturing a healthy pregnancy, and few are as celebrated or as aromatic as saffron milk. While modern medicine plays a crucial role in prenatal care, ancient remedies still hold value for many expecting mothers. Among them, saffron milk , a golden-hued, aromatic drink steeped in tradition. But how safe is it during pregnancy? Can a few strands of this luxurious spice truly benefit you and your baby? This article blends time-honored wisdom with scientific research to uncover the truth about saffron milk during pregnancy. What Is Saffron Milk? Saffron milk, often called kesar doodh , is a warm beverage made by infusing milk with a few strands of saffron. It may include other ingredients like cardamom, almonds, or turmeric, depending on cultural or personal preferences. Saffron, derived from the Crocus sativus flower, is the world’s most expensive spice by weight, prized for its distinctive aroma, vibrant color, and therapeutic properties. Traditionally used in Ayurvedic medicine , saffron milk is believed to boost immunity, improve complexion, and uplift mood. But during pregnancy, its benefits and risks warrant closer examination.

title: Is Oat Milk Good for Pregnancy? Nutritional Benefits & Expert Advice
description: When you’re expecting, every bite and sip you take matters. From morning sickness to late-night cravings, pregnancy comes with its own set of nutritional puzzles. Among the growing range of plant-based alternatives, oat milk has quickly risen as a favorite. But is oat milk good for pregnancy? If you’re curious about whether this creamy, dairy-free drink belongs in your prenatal diet, you’re not alone. Let’s explore how oat milk stacks up nutritionally, what benefits it offers for mom and baby, and what experts have to say.
